text: The biggest problem I have with this film (besides that it looks like cheaply made), is that it has an intentionally unsympathetic lead character (until he is "saved"), and  seems to only serve the purpose of pandering to people who already are militantly "Christian." This is opposed to a film like "Silence," which not only allows the non-religious to consider religion in a more meaningful way, but allows the religious to deepen and explore the complexities of their faith/challenge themselves, instead of hollowing echoing back rigid, simplistic beliefs. Essentially, this is propaganda for people who are afraid to explore ideas. A truly complex and compassionate version of this film would not turn the protagonist into a villian, but show how it is natural to question deeply held beliefs after loss and show how one's faith can grow stronger as a result.

text: This dishonest depiction of Atheists is based on what Christians are told Atheists are like. They get told other lies in order to instill a sense of fear, so that they won't have conversations with them, or even treat them as human, out of fear that they'll de-convert. This is a pointless fear to be sold, for logic and discussion did not ever get anyone involved in Christianity, so it poses no risk in getting them out of it.  Beyond this dishonesty, there is another dishonesty in the very premise of the movie itself. This is the flawed idea that an Atheist will convert to Christianity once something horrible happens to them. In all fairness, if someone were raised to be religious, slowly fell out of it, and THEN thought that MAYBE they were an Atheist [but were mistaken], this would then be an option, because they would be falling back on something.  Every Atheist has their own story. For me, I was NEVER indoctrinated as a child. As a result, I am lacking in the FEAR, the GUILT, and the MISPLACED TRUST in what my parents would say. These elements are ESSENTIAL for someone to believe in god. I've yet to meet a Christian who goes to church because they "love Jesus." It's always about FEAR. It's fear of satan and hell, and all about repenting and getting saved.  Because I am personally lacking in the elements required to believe, it is actually IMPOSSIBLE for me to become a Christian. This is because, for me, holding this belief has no value. It makes no sense. It's superstition, to me.  Since Christians have those immovable elements in their minds, thanks to childhood indoctrination, it is IMPOSSIBLE for them to NOT believe. They have no choice, and I have no choice as well. For even when someone was indoctrinated, and they fall out of their religious beliefs, they WILL fall back into it, either when they get older or when something bad happens. It's a case of returning to what one knows in an effort to bring comfort to themselves during a time when chaos seems to be the order of the day.  The most insulting part of the idea that an Atheist will convert when something bad happens, is that bad things have already happened in my life. Horrible, horrific things. Not once did I ever call upon a god of ANY kind, regardless of whether or not this god was commercially-available for purchase. Never, not because I'm somehow smarter than anyone else, because intelligence has nothing to do with it.  The part that SHOULD insult Christians the most is the LIES that this movie tells. I've noted the two big ones. I am familiar with Christian Mythology, and your god Yahweh had a TOP TEN list of "commandments." One of them was that it is a sin to "bear false witness." This means that it is wrong to lie. And yet, there are lies here that are being told in the name of the god who commanded that these lies not be told. This is a typical American Christian move, with the idea that if a lie saves a soul, then it is worth it.  This is how Donald Trump got elected by Christians. The bar is so low, that all one has to do is declare themselves to be a Christian, and that's it. No bible reading, no personal growth, no accountability, nothing. "TWO Corinthians?" REALLY? That's your representative?  This is but one of MANY reasons why Christians and Christianity cannot be taken seriously. Grown adults should know better. But that's the power of "childhood indoctrination," a nice way of speaking of "brainwashing children." It should be illegal. I know that Christians can't help it, because their brainwashing is powerful, but that does not remove my disappointment in you. The time has come to put away superstitious mythologies, and face life like a grown up.
author: DrumWild

text: The existence of such movies indicates Sorbo and likeminded people feeld they need to comfort a Christian audience somehow and save them from allegedly abrasive atheism.  Here ist what is the problem. Atheists faced disrespect from Christians for centuries or worse kept their lack of faith a secret not to incur a death sentence or similar.  In modern times with a free speech practise in media, atheists can express their criticism of faith(Christianity in this particular case) without fear of repercussions.  There is no law violated when an atheists points out errors in the bible, names famous bible scholars who shattered theological interpretations of the bible as wishful thinking(Ehrman, Carrier, Luedermann) or point out where Christians stray from their claimed virtues and refuse to accept this faith as sole source of wisdom, truth...you name it whatever.  Why do Christians lose confidence in the mere presence of atheism? Why is the confidence in your faith so weak that you cannot remain calm when others choose to believe differently or not at all?  As an atheist I do not care for what you believe, as long as I do not have to live by those rules derived from myths that I do not share, and that my kids or nieces and nephews enjoy a science curriculum that does not have to tiptoe around religious dogma, science is not there to comfort religious feelings, it never had that purpose.
author: Sebastian Schulz

text: I dont know whom Sorbo wanted to portray. An atheist does not blame a divine entity for the cancer of her/his child. Most atheists usually could not care less...atheists just want to be left unbothered by religious dogma....they prefer a different Sunday program. Their lives are full of meaning without worshipping any gods.

text: Wait... Let me get this right  The protagonist is an Atheist who is vindictive of God whom he blames for the death of his son?     Actually the last thing a real Atheist would do is blame God for anything because in the very first place he believes he does not exist. So if he does not exist, how could he have a hand in the death of his Son? Did the writer of this movie forget to use common sense?  An atheist would actually blame the direct causes of the death itself. Like the disease that his son had. Or the mechanical defects of the car that caused the accident. Or the late arrival of the paramedics. Or the murder. Or himself.  He can blame anyone, but there would not be any sense for him to blame God.
